cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles southeast of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the north-west Caribbean, forecast to turn north-northwest over the southeastern Gulf and make landfall along the Louisiana coast while remaining east of the Texas coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the Texas-Louisiana border eastward through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: 30–40 mph gusty winds possible Sunday into Monday with a 35 % chance of reaching tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible on the upper Texas coast if onshore flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may produce 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher, mainly late Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas likely along Gulf beaches
